PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly rem

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a chi

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies an

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. "Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung.

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation.

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more.

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversatio

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more.

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, jus

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more.

He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situati

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just h

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more.

How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and

How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more.

 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either wa

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more.

It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his b

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more.

The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what th

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more.

It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I bel

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.

He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..." He paused for a moment, "We are not alone in the

The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..." He pause

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..."

It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..."

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more.

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..."

"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..." 

They might not have been ready for it. But it was happening read

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..."

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..." 

They might not have been ready for it. But it was happening ready or not. And that, my friends is t

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..."

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. 

The President of France was speaking to the Prime Minister of England via video chat. "Well," President Hillar started, "What do you think we should do about them. It's rather sad really."

PM Frand responded "Yes, sad indeed. The state of the country..a disappointment even. Based on the old stories, would have thought they would have held up better. But, I suppose we should do something about them."

"Of course, it's not like we didn't try to contact them and let them know the plan was off. I distinctly remember the news stories from 40 years ago when I was a child. How all of the larger nations, former allies and former enemies reached out in every way possible. Stubborn Americans just wouldn't listen." The President of France nodded along to the PM's statement.
The President of the United States was sitting in his office, reading a book. when the technicians brought in the device. A gift from England to the US "our old friends" according the the communication. It was a communication device, one that allowed video calls with crystal clarity. He was told it was much better than the old tech, and that stung. What was to come stung even more. 
"Mr. President, we have a call for you from the Prime Minister of England."
 The President of the US answered, and the conversation that followed devastated him. He learned just how far behind they were, just how little they understood of the current situation, and worst of all, just how little the US mattered in the world now. It had moved on without them, and while the other nations didn't mind the US being back, they didn't really care either way to be honest.

The call over, the President sat back in his chair. "Well, that was a real kick in the teeth." He called in his cabinet, and they discussed what to do next, what they should tell the citizens. 
The next day, the President addressed the nation.
 "Fellow Americans, I have some news that may be hard to hear. But I believe you are ready for it..."
